tool.name: pcdl_make_movie
tool.command:
#import re mkdir timeseries && #for $file in $path: #set $filename = re.sub('[^\w\-\.\s]', '_', str($file.element_identifier)) ln -s $file timeseries/$filename && #end for
pcdl_make_movie timeseries $interface --framerate $framerate

param.name: path
param.label: path
param.help: images data collection from which the mp4 movie will be generated.

param.name: interface
param.label: interface
param.help: specify the image format from which the mp4 movie will be generated. these images can be generated with the pcdl_plot_scatter or pcdl_plot_contour function. default is jpeg.

param.name: framerate
param.label: values
param.help: specifies how many images per second will be used. humans are capable of processing 12 images per second and seeing them individually. higher rates are seen as motion. default is 12.

tool.help:
this function generates an mp4 movie file from all image files found in the path directory in the specified interface file format.
homepage: https://github.com/elmbeech/physicelldataloader
